item.title: The Biden economic boom.
item.description:
[Audio version here] Here is the biggest story you didn’t hear about over the weekend: The January jobs report was good. Very good. It was so good that it exceeded everyone’s expectations—including those of the White House. Given the (apparent) weak jobs reports for November and December, pundits were expecting more of the same in January. Sean…

item.title: Interview: Ryan Petersen, founder and CEO of Flexport
item.description:
For the last year or so, the global economy has been hammered by a massive supply chain crunch. The phenomenon is impossibly complex, encompassing a dizzying array of factors — demand shifts, the shift to e-commerce, Chinese industrial crackdowns, Covid, inflation, legacy regulations, trade imbalances, and much much more. But a small moment of clarity a…

URL: https://noahpinion.substack.com/p/interview-ryan-petersen-ceo-of-flexport?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.description:
There’s a line about career success I like that I’ve heard a couple of times on sports podcasts from ESPN anchor Scott Van Pelt, which he attributes to legendary former Maryland coach Lefty Driesell. The story is that the two met up sometime after Van Pelt’s broadcast career started going well, and Driesell congratulated him on his success. Van Pelt rep…

item.title: Looking for an American Myth
item.description:
One reflection of the political and social crisis in the country is the on-going battle of over myths of national origin and purpose. We can see this taking place now in the furious reaction to “Critical Race Theory,” now resulting in book banning and censorship. We can also see it in the intense anger and controversy generated by the 1619 Project, whic…

item.title: How to misinterpret clinical outcome data in populations by age subgroups
item.description:
Recently a headline in the New York Times was “Younger People Benefit Less From Boosters Than Older”. Of course they do, as risk of nearly any intervention in medicine along with its absolute benefit are less with younger age. But to imply that boosters don’t help younger people is a flawed interpretation…

URL: https://erictopol.substack.com/p/how-to-misinterpret-clinical-outcome?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web
